description: This file contains implementation of socket management functions for Ansc Broker TCP socket objects, including opening, closing, and finishing socket operations within the ANSC framework.

classes.name: ANSC_HANDLE
classes.description: Generic handle type used in function signatures.

classes.name: PANSC_BROKER_SOCKET_TCP_OBJECT
classes.description: Pointer to the structure representing a Broker TCP socket object.

classes.name: PANSC_BROKER_ENGINE_TCP_OBJECT
classes.description: Pointer to the structure representing the TCP engine managing socket objects.

classes.name: PANSC_BROKER_SERVER_TCP_OBJECT
classes.description: Pointer to the structure representing the TCP server context.

classes.name: PANSC_BSTO_WORKER_OBJECT
classes.description: Pointer to the worker object responsible for managing socket objects.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS AnscBktoFinish(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Closes the socket object, unregistering it from the engine if necessary.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS AnscBktoOpen(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Initializes and opens a socket connection, binding to local address and connecting to remote peer.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS AnscBktoClose(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Closes the socket and performs cleanup, notifying the worker object.
